title: Bug 118780: Incorrect column name displayed in expression builder after setting alias for columns in dataset
EB: In the expression builder, when selecting the dataset and double-clicking on the first column name, the expected result is that the alias name should be used instead of the original name. However, the actual result is that the original name of the column is displayed below the expression builder, while the alias name appears as row["column1"] above after double-clicking the original name.
SR:
Bug 118780: Incorrect column names displayed in expression builder after setting alias for columns in dataset.

Description: Set alias for columns in a dataset. However, when selecting the dataset in the expression builder, the old column names are still displayed instead of the alias names.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a new datasource and a dataset.
2. Set the alias of the first column in the dataset to "column1".
3. Insert a data item and bind it to the dataset.
4. Open the expression builder and select the dataset.
5. Double-click on the first column name.

Expected result: The alias name "column1" should be displayed in the expression builder.

Actual result: The original name of the column is displayed below the expression builder, while the alias name appears as row["column1"] above after double-clicking the original name.
